page.title: 09Farming 3 - Llwynycelyn
page.content: Here they keep and rear pheasants. These are released into the local woods and scrub land. There is approx. 1 sq.km. of woodland in the area. 500 pheasants are released into each wood. The keeper rears about 1000 pheasants a month. The farmers in this area are encouraged to keep some of their land free from the plough (either roughland or woodland). This is to tempt game birds such as pheasants, partridge and snipe onto the land. The shooting season starts on the 1st October till 1st February. It is a very expensive sport, as it costs Â£200 a day to shoot and the shooters can only keep a brace (two) pheasants, no matter how many they shoot. All the other pheaseants shot are sold for Â£1.75 each by the Llanarth estate.
